page.title: 11HOUSES OF INTEREST
page.content: HOUSES OF INTEREST WATTS BARN. It was built in 1807 by Mr.Watts a tenant farmer at Springs Farm ,part of the Dodington estate, as a barn for hay and cereals.The roof collapsed at the beginning of this century, but in I928 a 21 year lease was bought and Â£3000 spent on converting it into a house( at to-day's prices this would be about Â£200,000).During the last war it was occupied by 24 Land Army girls. In the I950s Watts Barn cottage was built to house the butler, for the house then had 4 or 5 servants.To-day the present owners have modernised the house so that they can look after it without servants. DEAN AND CHAPTER HOUSE.The oldest in Codrington,built as a monastery in the late C13th.It is linked by an underground passage to Court House.
